meta.description:
Vicky and David just bought a farm in the Yarra Valley and are considering using it to grow apples, pears, oranges, and lemons. The profit from growing one acre of apples is $2000, of pears is $1800, of oranges is $2200, and of lemons is $3000. In order to maximize profit, how many acres of land should they use to grow each fruit?
Vicky and David just bought a farm in the Yarra Valley and are considering using it to grow apples, pears, oranges, and lemons. The total land area is 120 acres.

The land area for growing apples should be at least twice the land area for growing pears.

The land area for growing apples should be at least three times the land area for growing lemons.

The land area for growing oranges must be twice the land area for growing lemons.

Vicky and David are not willing to grow more than two types of fruit.

sets.name: Fruits
sets.description: Types of fruits that can be grown on the farm.

params.name: profit
params.description: Profit per acre for each type of fruit.

vars.name: land
vars.description: Acres of land allocated to each type of fruit.

objective.name: max_profit
objective.expr: quicksum(profit[f] * land[f] for f in Fruits)
objective.description: Maximize the total profit from the farm.

constraints.name: apples_pears
constraints.description: Land for apples should be at least twice the land for pears.

constraints.name: apples_lemons
constraints.description: Land for apples should be at least three times the land for lemons.

constraints.name: oranges_lemons
constraints.description: Land for oranges must be twice the land for lemons.

constraints.name: max_two_fruits
constraints.expr_lhs: quicksum(1 for f in Fruits if land[f] > 0)
constraints.description: No more than two types of fruits can be grown.
